question: Golfers get angry when they are being held up. How can you avoid "slow play"*

choices.text: Leave your bag somewhere where you have to walk past it on the way to the next tee.
If you are not playing a match-play competition, tee off when you are ready rather than in the correct sequence.
If you can no longer score any points on a hole, simply pick up your ball and move to the next hole.
Look for your own ball before helping others look for theirs.
If the group behind you are waiting, and you are holding them up get them to pass you.

explanation: All are correct. "Calling someone through" allows the group behind you to take the lead and can be a good idea if you are having to look for a lost ball. Also, if you have taken so many shots that you can no longer score then give up and move to the next hole. But remember, if you are in a match-play competition you must tee off in the correct sequence, otherwise you can just go when you are ready.
